greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the generalized Glaisher-Kinkelin constant A(2).
comment: Also known as the second Bendersky constant.
This is likely the same as the constant B considered in section 3 of the Choi and Srivastava link. - _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 03 2016
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.15 Glaisher-Kinkelin constant, p. 137.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2002
J. Choi and H. M. Srivastava, Certain classes of series involving the zeta function, J. Math. Annal. Applic. 231 (1999) 91-117.
K. Kimoto, N. Kurokawa, C. Sonoki, M. Wakayama, Some examples of generalized zeta regularized products, Kodai Math. J. 27 (2004), 321-335.
Tobias Kyrion, A closed-form expression for zeta(3), arXiv:2008.05573 [math.GM], 2020.
formula: A(k) = exp(B(k+1)/(k+1)*H(k)-zeta'(-k)), where B(k) is the k-th Bernoulli number and H(k) the k-th harmonic number.
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 02 2014
